block.p: To the Editor: I read with interest the Practical Traveler article on car rentals in Italy (Oct. 20) and want to correct any impression that rental companies there are running a scam. The police everywhere try to enforce traffic laws, but car renters tend to ignore tickets issued far from home. So rental companies provide information about renters to the police. So far, so good.

What was not mentioned in the article is that fines in Italy double if they are not paid within 15 days of issue, e.g., a $40 fine would rise to $80. This is why companies, Eurodollar included, take a separate credit card imprint "for fines only": in case of a ticket, this saves the renter money.

We can do nothing about the way local authorities operate, but we believe we are providing a service within the existing system. After all, when in Rome . . . HENNING H. LUESSMANN Los Angeles
The writer heads North American sales for Eurodollar Rent A Car.
